meanings.definition: To spread or smear something thinly or evenly over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was shmeering the butter on her toast.
meanings.sent2: He shmeered the paint on the canvas with care.
meanings.sent3: The chef was shmeering the sauce on the pasta with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight shmeered through the trees, creating a dappled effect on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The artist shmeered the colors together to create a beautiful gradient.

meanings.definition: The act of spreading or smearing something.
meanings.sent1: The shmeering of jam on the bread was done delicately.
meanings.sent2: His shmeering of glue on the paper was messy.
meanings.sent3: The child's shmeering of mud on the wall caused a mess.
meanings.sent4: The shmeering of frosting on the cake was uneven but charming.
meanings.sent5: The shmeering of sunscreen on her skin protected her from the sun.

meanings.definition: A thin layer or coating of something.
meanings.sent1: The shmeering of dust on the furniture was noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The shmeering of oil on the pan made cooking easier.
meanings.sent3: The shmeering of icing on the cupcake was too thick.
meanings.sent4: The shmeering of snow on the ground made everything look magical.
meanings.sent5: The shmeering of sauce on the pizza added flavor to each bite.
